item.content:encoded:
This is a common error for people on VPS or certain hosting providers, for example infinityfree.

If you have your own VPS with root access, it’s an easy fix:

First, check your php version

php -v

Next, install the relevant imagick package, but first do:

sudo apt update

then, enter the relevant installer package for your php version, for example – if your php version came up as 7.4.30, then enter:

sudo apt install php7.4-imagick

Finally, restart the apache 2 service by entering either of the two commands below:

systemctl restart apache2

OR

service apache2 reload

item.content:encoded:
A personal bug-bear of mine: un-justified text!!

It just bugs me from a visual point-of-view.

Once upon a time, the Gutenberg editor in WordPress (before becoming the so-called block editor, I think we’re going back to 2018 or 19 here…) used to give you a justified text option, just like most word-processing apps do, along-side the usual left, middle or right alignment options.

2 ways: through custom CSS or editor toolbox plugin (other older plugins promising to restore the justified text options in wp editor don’t seem to work on the newer block themes).
